concise_definition: n. 奖品, 礼品, 潮流风格; v. 获取奖品, 装点

definitions.explanation_en: Free promotional items or gifts given out at events, conferences, or by brands to promote their image or products, often including apparel, accessories, or gadgets.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在活动、会议或品牌推广中免费发放的宣传礼品，通常包括服装、配饰或小工具，用于提升品牌形象。
definitions.example_en: Attendees at the tech conference left with bags full of swag: T-shirts, stickers, and wireless chargers.
definitions.example_cn: 参加科技大会的与会者带着满满一袋礼品离开：T恤、贴纸和无线充电器。

definitions.explanation_en: A confident, stylish, or arrogant manner of behavior, often associated with self-assuredness, fashion, or street culture; can imply a sense of coolness or bravado.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指一种自信、时尚或傲慢的行为举止，常与自我肯定、时尚或街头文化相关，带有酷炫或张扬的意味。
definitions.example_en: He walked into the room with so much swag that everyone turned to look.
definitions.example_cn: 他走进房间时气场十足，所有人都转头看他。

definitions.explanation_en: To obtain promotional items or free goods, often informally or without paying, especially at events or through opportunistic means.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指非正式地或通过机会主义手段获取免费礼品或宣传品，通常发生在活动场合。
definitions.example_en: I swagged a hoodie and a notebook at the product launch.
definitions.example_cn: 我在产品发布会上顺走了一件连帽衫和一个笔记本。

definitions.explanation_en: To decorate or adorn something with decorative fabric or fringe, especially in a traditional or rustic style.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指用装饰性织物或流苏来装点某物，尤指传统或乡村风格的装饰。
definitions.example_en: They swagged the curtains with velvet ribbons for the wedding.
definitions.example_cn: 他们用丝绒缎带装饰了婚礼的窗帘。

comparison.analysis: “Merchandise”（商品）泛指任何用于销售的产品，强调商业交易属性；而 “swag” 特指免费发放的宣传品，不以盈利为目的，更侧重品牌推广和情感联结。
“Cool”（酷）是一个形容词，描述一种态度或风格的评价；而 “swag” 作为名词时，是这种酷感的具体表现或外在体现，是可观察的行为或装扮，更具物质性和行为性。
“Gift”（礼物）是广义的馈赠，可出于亲情、友情或礼仪；而 “swag” 专指品牌或商业活动中的宣传性赠品，带有营销目的，通常不具个人情感色彩。
“Flair”（天赋/风格）指一种自然流露的才能或审美品味，是内在特质；而 “swag” 是外在展示的自信姿态或装扮，更强调表演性和公众印象，有时甚至带有夸张或做作的成分。
